thread.title: Morris can't overcome quick start by DeKalb
thread.title_full: Morris can't overcome quick start by DeKalb

title: Morris can't overcome quick start by DeKalb
text:
Morris can't overcome quick start by DeKalb Published: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 11:45 p.m. CDT • Updated: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 11:48 p.m. CDT Caption (Craig Lincoln for Shaw Media) Delaney Stutzki caught three passes for 55 yards and a touchdown in Morris' 35-21 loss to DeKalb on Friday night. By ROB OESTERLE - roesterle@shawmedia.com 
MORRIS — In the final 27 minutes of Friday night's Northern Illinois Big XII East game, the Morris football team outscored DeKalb 21-7. Related Links Guth, defense lead Morris to win vs. Sterling 
Unfortunately for the Redskins, DeKalb had built a 28-0 lead in the first 21 minutes, and the Barbs came away with a 35-21 victory. 
DeKalb's Derek Kyler threw for 157 yards and four touchdowns in the first half, with three of the scores going to Cole Tucker. The first was a 97-yarder after a Morris punt had pinned DeKalb at the 1-yard line. Kyler then hit James Robinson with a 20-yard scoring pass before connecting with Tucker for scores of 6 and 15 yards. 
Morris (3-3, 0-2) got on the board late in the first half on a 36-yard halfback pass from Keagan Sobol to Delaney Stutzki to make it 28-7 at halftime. DeKalb's David Long scored from nine yards out on the first possession of the second half to make it 35-7, but Morris answered wtih a 38-yard touchdown pass from Nathan Guth to Tommy Balentine. The Redskins capped the scoring with 2:45 to play on a three-yard run by Michael Feeney, who finished with 95 yards rushing on 14 carries.
